metadata.title: CVE-2019-7443 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
KDE KAuth before 5.55 allows the passing of parameters with arbitrary typesto helpers running as root over DBus via DBusHelperProxy.cpp. Certain typescan cause crashes, and trigger the decoding of arbitrary images withdynamically loaded plugins. In other words, KAuth unintentionally causesthis plugin code to run as root, which increases the severity of anypossible exploitation of a plugin vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7443` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkf5auth-data - 5.68.0-0ubuntu1
libkf5auth5 - 5.68.0-0ubuntu1
libkf5authcore5 - 5.68.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kauth package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.68.0-0ubuntu1').
